In a message dated 5/15/2004 5:47:35 PM Central Daylight Time, 
jggilbert@... writes:
They're grouped under Heianjo, but they are a consistent sub-style.  They 
have those deeply hammered plates almost like Tembo work, and the brass inlay 
motifs vary but don't seem to directly relate to the forming of the plate. 
Ron, Rich, Jim et al,

Thank you all for your opinions, greatly appreciated !!

By the way, the brass inlays are positioned on the " flip side " of the 
hammered " depressions ".

milt
